target.mrk: dataEncryption=true attribute

target.mrk: encrypting databases

seg-source.mrk: data encryption

target.mrk: data encryption

seg-source.mrk: dataEncryption

target.mrk: dataEncryption

seg-source.mrk: Function

target.mrk: Function

trans-unit.source: Specifies data encryption on disk for a new database or to configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption. For information about data encryption, see "Encrypting databases on disk" in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies data encryption on disk for a new database or to configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption.
For information about data encryption, see "Encrypting databases on disk" in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

target.mrk: Specifies data encryption on disk for a new database or to configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption.
For information about data encryption, see "Encrypting databases on disk" in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

trans-unit.source: After you encrypt a database, you can return it to the unencrypted state by specifying the decryptDatabase=true attribute.

seg-source.mrk: After you encrypt a database, you can return it to the unencrypted state by specifying the decryptDatabase=true attribute.

target.mrk: After you encrypt a database, you can return it to the unencrypted state by specifying the decryptDatabase=true attribute.

seg-source.mrk: Combining with other attributes

target.mrk: Combining with other attributes

trans-unit.source: The dataEncryption=true attribute must be combined with either the bootPassword=key attribute or the encryptionKey=key attribute.

seg-source.mrk: The dataEncryption=true attribute must be combined with either the bootPassword=key attribute or the encryptionKey=key attribute.

target.mrk: The dataEncryption=true attribute must be combined with either the bootPassword=key attribute or the encryptionKey=key attribute.

trans-unit.source: With either bootPassword=key or encryptionKey=key, you have the option of also specifying the encryptionProvider=providerName, encryptionAlgorithm=algorithm, and/or encryptionKeyLength=length attributes.

seg-source.mrk: With either bootPassword=key or encryptionKey=key, you have the option of also specifying the encryptionProvider=providerName, encryptionAlgorithm=algorithm, and/or encryptionKeyLength=length attributes.

target.mrk: With either bootPassword=key or encryptionKey=key, you have the option of also specifying the encryptionProvider=providerName, encryptionAlgorithm=algorithm, and/or encryptionKeyLength=length attributes.

trans-unit.source: An encryption key and a boot password use different storage mechanisms, so if, for example, you create a database using a boot password, you must continue to specify a boot password when you boot the database; you cannot switch to an encryption key. You can change either the boot password or the encryption key by specifying newBootPassword=newPassword or newEncryptionKey=key.

seg-source.mrk: An encryption key and a boot password use different storage mechanisms, so if, for example, you create a database using a boot password, you must continue to specify a boot password when you boot the database; you cannot switch to an encryption key.
You can change either the boot password or the encryption key by specifying newBootPassword=newPassword or newEncryptionKey=key.

target.mrk: An encryption key and a boot password use different storage mechanisms, so if, for example, you create a database using a boot password, you must continue to specify a boot password when you boot the database; you cannot switch to an encryption key.
You can change either the boot password or the encryption key by specifying newBootPassword=newPassword or newEncryptionKey=key.

trans-unit.source: For an existing, unencrypted database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can perform encryption. See also "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: For an existing, unencrypted database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can perform encryption.
See also "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

target.mrk: For an existing, unencrypted database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can perform encryption.
See also "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

trans-unit.source: After you encrypt an existing, unencrypted database, be sure to check for SQLWarnings. The encryption succeeded only if there were no SQLWarnings or SQLExceptions.

seg-source.mrk: After you encrypt an existing, unencrypted database, be sure to check for SQLWarnings.
The encryption succeeded only if there were no SQLWarnings or SQLExceptions.

target.mrk: After you encrypt an existing, unencrypted database, be sure to check for SQLWarnings.
The encryption succeeded only if there were no SQLWarnings or SQLExceptions.

seg-source.mrk: Examples

target.mrk: Examples

trans-unit.source: -- encrypt a new database jdbc:derby:encryptedDB;create=true;dataEncryption=true; bootPassword=cLo4u922sc23aPe -- configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption jdbc:derby:salesdb;dataEncryption=true;bootPassword=cLo4u922sc23aPe

seg-source.mrk: -- encrypt a new database jdbc:derby:encryptedDB;create=true;dataEncryption=true; bootPassword=cLo4u922sc23aPe -- configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption jdbc:derby:salesdb;dataEncryption=true;bootPassword=cLo4u922sc23aPe

target.mrk: -- encrypt a new database jdbc:derby:encryptedDB;create=true;dataEncryption=true; bootPassword=cLo4u922sc23aPe -- configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption jdbc:derby:salesdb;dataEncryption=true;bootPassword=cLo4u922sc23aPe
